title: Todays Ride and a Question
content: Today's ride was a little shorter than average, but made much more difficult by a strong headwind and some especially long hills.  The good news is that I felt strong climbing some of the hills and loved hitting 60kph on some of the downhill sections.  Putting in more time on the bike makes things better each week.  A question for all the fitness people out there (runners, cyclists, etc.)  Currently I am using Hammer products in my water bottles (Heed and Perpetuum)  However, these are difficult to find.  Is there any, easily available in Ontario, product you use.  I definitely need electrolytes, and I need something with some easily digestible calories to keep me going.  I can more easily shop at Shopper's Drug Mart, Popeyes, GNC, Superstore and even Walmart than some cycle shops which seem out of the way and often closed when I have time to go.  Would really love some recommendations.  If you know some cyclists, please forward them my question because I want as much advice as I can get.  Thank you.
